footer.description: A volunteer-built project connecting people with compassionate, free or low-cost care across Southeast Michigan. We believe healthcare is a right, not a luxury.
footer.copyright: ZB Impact. Built with community partners and volunteer clinicians.

home.heroTitle: Finding care should feel supportive, not stressful.
home.heroBody: We compile and maintain a clinic finder that helps people locate free and low-cost medical, dental, and mental health care, without the confusion of figuring out where to start.
home.carePathwayBody: Our clinic finder brings together verified information on free and low-cost clinics, all in one place. Use the steps below to find care and know what to expect before your visit.

pathway.title: Search for clinics
pathway.body: Use the clinic finder to browse free and sliding-scale clinics by location and type of care.

pathway.title: Review clinic details
pathway.body: Check services offered, cost information, and what documents may be required.

pathway.title: Contact the clinic directly
pathway.body: Reach out to the clinic to schedule an appointment or confirm eligibility.

home.servicesSubtitle: Filter clinics by service, language, age group, verification status, and distance. We keep every profile current so you can focus on next steps.

services.title: Primary & Preventive
services.summary: Community clinics for annual checkups, prenatal care, vaccinations, and chronic condition support.

services.title: Dental & Vision
services.summary: Preventive cleanings, emergency extractions, restorative care, eye exams, and affordable glasses programs.

services.title: Behavioral Health
services.summary: Counseling, addiction recovery, group therapy, and telehealth options tailored to low-cost access.

services.title: Pediatrics & Family
services.summary: Care for kids of every age — from wellness visits and sports physicals to immunization catch-up clinics.

services.title: Women’s Health
services.summary: OB-GYN services, cancer screenings, birth support, and reproductive health resources with trauma-informed staff.

services.title: Specialty Referrals
services.summary: Connections to oncology, cardiology, and surgical partners offering charity care and sliding-scale billing.

home.faqSubtitle: Our navigators compiled the questions they hear most often. Still unsure? Call us or send a note to

faqs.q: Is my information shared with clinics?
faqs.a: No. We never store personal health details. You choose when to contact a clinic and what to share with them directly.

faqs.q: How do you verify the clinics?
faqs.a: Our volunteer researchers confirm services, hours, and eligibility every 30 days. Clinics marked Verified have spoken with our intake team in the last two weeks.
Many clinics offer bus vouchers or ride-share credits. Look for the Access icon on a clinic profile or email our navigators at hello@zbimpact.org for support.

faqs.q: Do you cover mental health services?
faqs.a: Yes. Use the Clinic Finder filters to surface counseling, psychiatry, recovery, and peer support programs.

home.ctaBody: Whether this is your first visit or you are coordinating care for an entire shelter, ZB Impact gives you a calm starting point. Log in for volunteer tools or jump straight into the finder.

zipQuickStart.label: Quick search
zipQuickStart.prompt: Enter your ZIP code or address to find nearby clinics.
zipQuickStart.privacy: No account needed. We never store your location.
zipQuickStart.noInsuranceBody: Every clinic in our finder accepts uninsured patients. Many offer sliding-scale fees based on income, so you only pay what you can afford.

finder.title: Clinic Finder
finder.subtitle: Enter an address or share your location to surface free and low-cost clinics. Every result includes our latest notes on eligibility, languages, and transportation support.
finder.noClinicsInRadius: No clinics within {radius} miles yet—try widening the radius.
finder.enterAddress: Enter an address above or press “Use my location” to unlock nearby options.
finder.noRequestsSent: No appointment requests are sent until you choose a clinic.
finder.tip: Tip: If you are searching for someone else, add their city or zip and keep the phone number ready in case the clinic needs verbal consent.
finder.loadingSubtext: One moment while we prepare the clinic map and search tools for you.

results.tryBroaderRadius: Try a broader radius or search with a nearby landmark.
results.navigatorsWillGuide: and our navigators will guide you.

clinicDetail.noSummary: No summary yet. Visit the website above for more details.
clinicDetail.errorLoading: Error loading clinic. Please try again.

mission.title: ZB Impact Mission Statement
mission.heroBody: ZB Impact was born from a deeply personal loss. After our founder’s grandmother was diagnosed with liver cancer, the family struggled to find timely and affordable treatment—only to discover options when it was too late. Her story fuels our mission: to ensure that no one is left behind simply because they lack insurance.
mission.paragraph1: We are dedicated to connecting individuals and families in need with compassionate healthcare providers, clinics, and resources—bridging the gap between care and accessibility. Through advocacy, community partnerships, and direct support, ZB Impact strives to make quality healthcare a right, not a privilege.
mission.paragraph2: Our mission is simple but urgent: to turn loss into purpose and compassion into access—so that every life has a fighting chance.

prepare.title: Show up confident. Leave with answers.
prepare.subtitle: Use this guide to feel ready for any free or low-cost clinic appointment. Preparing a few essentials protects your time and makes it easier for staff to care for you.

sections.title: Identification
sections.body: Bring a photo ID if you have one. Clinics accept state IDs, passports, school IDs, or work badges—anything that confirms who you are.

sections.title: Medication list
sections.body: Write down every medication and supplement you take, plus dosage and timing. Snap a photo of the bottles if that’s easier.

sections.title: Medical history
sections.body: Any lab work, referral notes, imaging, or discharge instructions help providers understand your story faster.

sections.title: Proof of income
sections.body: Sliding-scale clinics may ask for a recent pay stub, W-2, or letter from an employer. Some will accept a self-written note.

sections.title: Proof of residence
sections.body: A lease, utility bill, or shelter letter with your name and current address keeps enrollment smooth.

sections.title: Insurance card
sections.body: If you have insurance, bring the card. If not, note your last coverage so navigators can discuss options.

sections.title: Question list
sections.body: Arrive with the concerns you want to address. It keeps the visit focused, especially if nerves kick in.

prepare.dayOfRemindersSubtitle: A little planning goes a long way. Share these with anyone joining you so you all feel at ease.
reminders: Confirm hours the morning of your visit—many clinics adjust schedules weekly.
Pack a snack and water bottle, especially if you manage blood sugar or blood pressure.
If transportation is a barrier, call to ask about bus vouchers or ride support before your visit.
Need child care while you are in the appointment? Some clinics can help arrange it if you call ahead.
prepare.unsureNote: Unsure about documentation? Call the clinic a day ahead or contact our navigators at

whatToBring.title: Walk in prepared. Walk out cared for.
whatToBring.subtitle: Every clinic is different. Use this checklist so intake goes quickly and you spend your visit focusing on your health—not paperwork.

items.photoId: Photo ID (driver’s license, passport, school ID) if available
items.proofAddress: Proof of address (mail, lease, or bill) if available
items.insuranceCard: Insurance card or policy number, if you have one
items.slidingScale: Small payment for sliding-scale fees (some clinics request $5–$20)
items.currentMeds: Current medications (or a written list with doses)
items.recentTests: Recent test results or imaging discs if you have them
items.dental: Dental: prior x-rays, treatment notes, or guard
items.vision: Vision: current glasses or contact prescription
items.pediatric: Pediatric: child’s ID, immunization card, and guardian authorization if needed
items.assistive: Assistive devices, mobility needs, or sensory accommodations
items.supportPerson: Support person who can accompany you if desired
items.arriveEarly: Arrive 15 minutes early and keep a list of questions
items.callAhead: Call ahead to confirm hours, documents, and payment (if any)
items.phoneBackup: Store photos of documents in your phone as a backup

whatToBring.finderSuggestion: Need a clinic suggestion? Use the finder to filter by services, cost, language, transportation, and more.
whatToBring.loadingSubtext: One moment while we get things ready.

login.subtitle: Volunteer admins use this portal to keep clinics accurate and compassionate.
